entry.title: Lavender Marriage
entry.summary:
Author: TheBobblehat

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 81,811Chapters: 19/?Kudos: 447

Summary: Lex Luthor has sponsored the new wing of the Metropolis Science Museum, and Clark and Bruce both suspect foul play. While in the geology exhibit, they discover an unknown strand of kryptonite, which cripples Clark almost immediately. Bruce drags him away, but just as they're catching their breath, a mysterious gunman fires on Clark from the shadows, piercing his heart with a bullet, specially made from Luthor's new find.Bruce gets Clark to a safe house and manages to extract the bullet, but not before saving Clark from its strange effects. When he wakes up, Clark recognizes Bruce. But not as his caped companion, or a fellow member of the League. They aren't competitors, allies, or even just friends.According to Clark, Bruce Wayne is his husband.

entry.title: Temptation is One Hell of a Thing
entry.summary:
Author: acatcam

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,947Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 33

Summary: Bruce Wayne never expected to walk into a church again—let alone with his four-year-old son in his arms. But when a meeting with Clark Kent, a priest. It turns into more than polite conversation, Bruce finds himself disarmed by a man who shouldn’t have surprised him at all. Clark is broad-shouldered, and impossibly kind; a believer in things Bruce turned his back on the day of his parents’ funeral.Bruce is skeptical, Clark is steadfast. Their ideologies clash from the moment they sit across from one another: billionaire pragmatism versus the faith of a priest. But somewhere between coloring books at Clark’s desk and quiet invitations to community fairs, a dangerous warmth grows. Bruce doesn’t know how to name it, and Clark doesn’t dare.Because whatever is happening between them—it shouldn’t. Bruce pushes, searching for the language he can’t bring himself to say aloud, while Clark whispers what he shouldn’t confess at all: I can’t. A vow binds him to the Church, but his heart betrays him in every secret meeting, every glance held too long.It shouldn’t work. It can’t work. But it does. And as much Clark Kent prays, temptation seeps through.

entry.title: Lean On Me
entry.summary:
Author: Its_Bravo

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 15,701Chapters: 18/18Kudos: 11

Summary: After a brutal battle leaves Bruce severely injured, Clark stays in Gotham—not as Superman, but as himself—to help Bruce through recovery. Days stretch into nights, and the quiet rhythms of care, shared meals, and small domestic rituals slowly build a fragile intimacy between them. Trust, vulnerability, and unspoken feelings bloom amid the shadows of trauma, fear, and pride.Over time, the walls Bruce has built crumble, Clark learns the delicate art of patience, and together they discover that home can be found in the most unexpected places—sometimes in the people we choose to stay with.A slow-burn, domestic, hurt/comfort story about two men learning to rely on each other, one small gesture at a time.

entry.title: Gotham Gala Sweethearts
entry.summary:
Author: forestofsprites

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,917Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 27

Summary: Contrary to popular belief, Clark doesn’t dislike his run-ins with Bruce Wayne. Truth be told, every time the duo unite at a function they end up playing something of a game. It's a rehearsed one - mainly acting like daft teenagers who snuck their way into the adults' party - but tonight, it seems there's something a little more ... veracious in the air.- He can’t walk up to Bruce straight away - no, no, this is all a practiced part of the play. He has to saunter vaguely, riding the edge of the wall with practised, uneasy eyes for a lap or two. He nods and shakes hands with whichever debutantes he’s come to know in his line of work, politely informing them that he’s off-duty this evening and here in a purely idle capacity, which in return earns him a more genuine smile and a sly quip about Mr. Wayne’s choice in curtains. Clark then proceeds to do them all the favour of not mentioning that he helped the billionaire select the colour himself.
